chapter.title: Managing Account Balance
chapter.para: This chapter helps you to monitor activities of your call and notice accounts and explains how to view account statements using Opics Portal.

section.title: Displaying Account Summary
section.para: Using Opics Portal, you can access and view a list of all call and notice and safekeeping accounts of a customer or a group of customers. You can also view projected daily balances and account activities. Depending on the end user account permissions, the portal displays the account balance and statements.
In the portal Home page, click Account Balance and then click Balances. Specify the Account Number and the Ccy and click Search to view account information.

section.title: Output
section.para: The result displays basic details of your account as given below.

entry.para: Displays short name of the customer.
Indicates the description of the account.
Indicates the bank with which your account is maintained.
Displays the call and notice or safekeeping account number.
Indicates a free-format text field that contains additional information about the account.
Displays the currency in which the account is denominated.
Displays the current balance of the call and notice account.
Displays the current branch processing date.
Displays the opening balance of the account.

note.para: : This value represents the previous end of day balance of the branch processing date.

entry.para: Displays the date the last statement was generated for the account.
Displays the closing balance that appeared on the last generated statement.

section.para: You can also view the status of individual accounts, whether they are Open, Closed, or Blocked. Moreover, you can also view additional details about the accounts, such as account position by date or by account activity.

section.title: Account Position by Date
section.para: From the list of accounts, you can provide further details about a particular account and retrieve additional information about it. The portal displays the starting balance of the account along with a list of projected balances for each future date.
For each value date, the portal displays a sum of all debit and credit balances and also the cumulative balance.

section.title: Verifying Account Activities
section.para: Using Opics Portal, you can view a list of all transactions created since the last statement generation date. The same list is also accessible from the projected balance inquiry screen, though the list is filtered by the projected value date.
The activity list displays the following details.

entry.para: Indicates the date the deposit or withdrawal takes value against the account.
Indicates the customer reference number of the deposit or withdrawal.
Identifies the check number that is associated with the deposit.
Displays the movement number, deposit, or withdrawal indicator and statement text of the deposit or withdrawal.
Identifies the deposit or withdrawal amount.
Identifies the date the deal was entered.

note.para: : For the list of accounts and transaction details, you can filter and/or sort the results returned from the portal on a single or multi-column basis.
